clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of TAF in Pregnant Women With Chronic Hepatitis B Infection
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of TAF in Pregnant Women With Chronic Hepatitis B Infection

lead_sponsor.agency: Third Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

clinical_study.source: Third Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

brief_summary.textblock: The effectiveness of mother-to-child block of CHB in pregnant women in the middle and later stages of pregnancy has been recognized by the guidelines. TAF, as a newly marketed antiviral drug, has not been conclusively concluded in terms of its efficacy and postpartum safety in preventing mother-to-child transmission in pregnant women.Our purpose is to explore the TAF for CHB the curative effect of pregnant and postnatal security.

detailed_description.textblock: After diagnosis at the infection clinic of the Third Affiliated Hospital of Sun Yat-sen University, the eligible patients were enrolled into the group.Each person will sign the informed consent prior to enrollment.

primary_outcome.description: The level of liver function (ALT、AST)、HBV DNA、HBV Serological markers (HBsAg、HBeAg、HBeAb) in pregnant women at birth.
The level of liver function (ALT、AST)、HBV DNA、HBV Serological markers (HBsAg、HBeAg、HBeAb) in pregnant women 1 month、3 month、7 month、9 month、12 month after delivery.

secondary_outcome.description: The level of liver function (ALT、AST)、HBV DNA、HBV Serological markers (HBsAg、HBeAg、HBeAb) in pregnant women taking TAF 0、4、8、12 weeks.

arm_group.description: Start taking TAF at 24 weeks of gestation until delivery. The liver function, viral load and antigen status were reviewed monthly and 10 ml peripheral blood was collected.
Nonpregnant women taking TAF for antiviral therapy were regularly rechecked for liver function, viral load, and antigens.

intervention.description: TAF was administered to pregnant women with CHB during pregnancy for mother-to-child interention.Women with chronic hepatitis B who are not pregnant receive TAF for antiviral treatment.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Third Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University
